p: As in C. medica, the percentage of limonene may drop to 39.9% in the oil of C. aurantifolia ( Lota et al., 2002), and the abundance of other terpene compounds is increased, such as β-pinene, neryl acetate, geranyl acetate, β-bisabolene, ( E)-α-bergamotene, germacrene D and β-caryophyllene ( Lota et al., 2002; Minh Tu et al., 2002a), similarly to what occurs in C. medica.
